question: Memory management is how a computer organizes and controls its ________ to store and retrieve data efficiently.
In ________ partitioning, memory is divided into fixed-sized blocks before running any program.
The type of partitioning that eliminates internal fragmentation but can cause external fragmentation is ________ partitioning.
In ________ partitioning, memory is divided into partitions dynamically as needed.
The condition where small free spaces exist between memory partitions is called ________ fragmentation.
The ________ method represents memory as a sequence of bits (0s and 1s) to track free and occupied memory blocks.
In the bitmap method, a ________ represents an occupied memory block, while a 0 represents a free block.
The ________ method organizes memory blocks as a linked list where each block points to the next available block.
In the linked list method, a free list stores ________ memory blocks.
The linked list method requires extra memory to store ________ for each memory block.
In fixed partitioning, if a process is smaller than the partition, the extra space is called ________ fragmentation.
Fixed partitioning offers ________ flexibility because the partitions are predefined.
The ________ technique is easy to track free and used memory but can be slow when searching for free memory.
In the linked list method, each memory block has a ________ to the next block in the list.
________ partitioning eliminates internal fragmentation but may lead to external fragmentation.
________ memory management techniques are used by the OS to allocate memory to processes based on availability and size requirements.
In fixed partitioning, if a process is larger than the partition, it ________ be loaded.
In variable partitioning, the partitions are created based on the ________ of the program.
The bitmap method uses a sequence of ________ to represent memory blocks, where 1 means occupied and 0 means free.
The linked list method stores free memory blocks in a ________ list.
